data.event: Riverton was formerly part of the Riverton-Boulevard Park CDP, which was split up for the 2010 census into Riverton and Boulevard Park.

event.title: refers to a neighboring former community in part of what is now

data.event: Riverton also refers to a neighboring former community in part of what is now Tukwila in the Duwamish River Valley.

event.title: known as the Riverton Draw Bridge, the Riverton Drawspan, and King County Bridge 622-A. Built 1903

data.event: Riverton lent its name to an early 20th-century bridge, variously known as the Riverton Draw Bridge, the Riverton Drawspan, and King County Bridge 622-A. Built 1903, the bridge developed a reputation for being rather unsafe.
It closed to vehicles 1919, and was demolished 1927.
It closed to vehicles 1919, and was demolished 1927.
